                    Benzoylecgonine

Computed by PubChem 2.2 (PubChem release 2025.04.14)

Dates

Create:

2005-06-08

Modify:

2025-04-19

Description

Ecgonine benzoate is a benzoate ester metabolite of cocaine formed by hydrolysis of the methyl ester group, catalysed by carboxylesterases. It has a role as an epitope, a marine xenobiotic metabolite, a plant metabolite and a human xenobiotic metabolite. It is a tropane alkaloid and a benzoate ester. It is functionally related to an ecgonine.


                    Context: 
                    This chunk provides key identifying information about Benzoylecgonine, including its PubChem CID, molecular formula (C16H19NO4), molecular weight, synonyms, and chemical safety classification as acutely toxic. It also includes a brief description of Benzoylecgonine as a major cocaine metabolite formed by enzymatic hydrolysis, highlighting its biochemical relevance as a tropane alkaloid and benzoate ester. This section serves as a concise summary and introduction within the larger document detailing Benzoylecgonine’s chemical, biological, and safety properties.

metadata.title: Benzoylecgonine | C16H19NO4 | CID 448223 - PubChem
metadata.description: Benzoylecgonine | C16H19NO4 | CID 448223 - structure, chemical names, physical and chemical properties, classification, patents, literature, biological activities, safety/hazards/toxicity information, supplier lists, and more.

content:
Drug: Benzoylecgonine | cid: 448223
Source: pubchem | Source description: Benzoylecgonine | C16H19NO4 | CID 448223 - structure, chemical names, physical and chemical properties, classification, patents, literature, biological activities, safety/hazards/toxicity information, supplier lists, and more.

                    Text: 
                    Benzoylecgonine is the major metabolite of cocaine. It is formed by hydrolysis of cocaine in the liver, catalysed by carboxylesterases. It is excreted in the urine of cocaine users after processing in the liver. It is the main pharmaceutical ingredient in the investigational drug Esterom, a topical solution used for the relief of muscle pain that is not FDA approved or on the market in the United States.

Benzoylecgonine has been reported in Erythroxylum coca with data available.

Contents

InChI=1S/C16H19NO4/c1-17-11-7-8-12(17)14(15(18)19)13(9-11)21-16(20)10-5-3-2-4-6-10/h2-6,11-14H,7-9H2,1H3,(H,18,19)/t11-,12+,13-,14+/m0/s1


                    Context: 
                    This section provides a detailed description of benzoylecgonine, highlighting its role as the major metabolite of cocaine formed in the liver and excreted in urine. It also notes its presence in Erythroxylum coca and its use as the main ingredient in the investigational drug Esterom. The content introduces structural information and key chemical identifiers, situating benzoylecgonine within the broader chemical and pharmacological context of the full document.
